solution_line_template: In {cycle_duration} minutes, {water_flowed_in_cycle} liters of water flow into the bathtub and {water_escaped_cycle} liters ({cycle_duration} minutes x {leak_rate_per_minute} liter/minute ) escape.
This will leave {water_flowed_in_cycle} - {water_escaped_cycle} = <<{water_flowed_in_cycle}-{water_escaped_cycle}={net_gain_per_cycle}>>{net_gain_per_cycle} liters of water every two minutes

We can divide the number of liters by the number of minutes to find the average flow per minute, which is {net_gain_per_cycle} / {cycle_duration} = <<{net_gain_per_cycle}/{cycle_duration}={average_flow_rate}>>{average_flow_rate} liters per minute
To fill the tub, it will take {tub_capacity} liters / {average_flow_rate} liters/min = <<{tub_capacity}/{average_flow_rate}={time_to_fill_tub}>>{time_to_fill_tub} min
